profile: Green Valley Irrigation offers complete solutions to your irrigation needs. We specialize in engineering state-of-the-art water conscious irrigation systems using industry established technologies maintaining reliability and economy. We are well-versed in the latest equipment and installation techniques that will ensure a water-efficient system, maintaining reliability, and competitive pricing. It is important to provide this expertise promptly and courteously to our customers. We realize your time is extremely valuable, so we will come onsite for an initial consultation that will outline the basic requirements and review important factors needed to complete your irrigation needs. To ensure the highest-quality installation and optimum operation of your sprinkler system, we will send a Professional Irrigator who will provide a professional design for planning and ease of viewing. We'll work with you to define a plan of action to meet your personal and financial requirements. And after installation is complete, we will show you every detail of the proper operation of your new irrigation system. We make sure all the steps are taken to perform the service at the your convenience. Here are several key characteristics to look for when evaluating the water efficiency of a lawn sprinkler system: Matched-Precipitation Rate Sprinkler Heads All sprinkler heads on a given circuit should be the same type (e.g. rotors, pop-up spray, etc.) and have matched precipitation rate (in inches per hour). Heads with differing precipitation rates have widely varying operating times, which can lead to the over-watering of one area in order to sufficiently water another. Head-to-Head Coverage sprinkler installation Turf pop-up sprinkler systems are designed to operate with head-to-head coverage, where the spray from one sprinkler head reaches to the next, resulting in necessary overlap. Precipitation rates are based on the assumption of overlap. Places where the sprinkler's spray pattern does not overlap are likely not getting sufficient water and may develop brown dry spots. These spots indicate the system has low "uniformity" of coverage. To compensate, one has to run the sprinklers for longer times to get adequate water to the dry spots, while the rest of the lawn is getting over-watered. Precipitation Rate That Does Not Exceed the Soil's Infiltration Rate Based upon soil characteristics, water will soak into the ground at differing rates. Sandy soils have high (fast) infiltration rates, while clay soils have low (slow) infiltration rates. If the precipitation rate of the sprinkler heads exceeds the soil's infiltration rate, then runoff and erosion occur (especially on slopes). On flat ground, this will also lead to piddling. If your sprinklers' precipitation rate exceeds the infiltration rate, lower precipitation rate heads can be installed, or you can shorten your watering times and use multiple start times (e.g. 3 start times at 5 minutes each at 1-hour intervals instead of 15 minutes all at once) to allow the water to soak into the soil. Appropriate Water Pressure Each sprinkler head is designed to operate within a certain range of pressure, typically around 40 to 50 pounds per square inch (PSI). When water pressure is too low, the sprinkler head will emit large drops and likely will not produce the proper spray pattern or a radius that reaches to the next head. If pressure is too high, the head will produce a fine mist, which leads to water loss due to evaporation and "fly-away" in even light winds. In addition, high pressure can lead to over spray and a distorted spray pattern, along with many other problems. Clean, Even Spray Pattern If the spray pattern of a head is distorted, browns spots may develop on the lawn. This may be caused by blockage in the screen or in the nozzle itself, and the head may need to be cleaned. If this does not fix the problem, the nozzle may be worn and needs to be replaced. There should be no wasteful over spray onto sidewalk, patio, driveway or street. If there is over spray, replace the nozzle with another with the appropriate spray pattern (e.g. 1800 instead of 3600) or relocate the sprinkler head. Vegetation or other objects should not obstruct the spray from the head. Trim back vegetation or raise the sprinkler heads as needed. This will increase the system's uniformity of coverage.

profile:
Pro Green Irrigation is a lawn sprinkler professional, offering a wide variety of services, which includes new installations, service to existing systems, and annual maintenance programs. Pro Green manufactures a time-controlled underground sprinkler system which eliminates the routine and monotonous job of hand watering and also savers water.  

***

The Automatic Sprinkler Systems from Pro Green Irrigation and gives your valuable landscape the uniform coverage it needs to stay healthy and vigorous.
Pro Green Irrigation is a family business with all of the advantages of a large company. While our focus is on residential customers, Pro Green also installs and services commercial systems in strip malls, warehouses, subway stations, hospitals, golf course club houses and office buildings. Whether you're a homeowner, developer, management company or general contractor, our goal is to give you the caring attention of a small family-run business, while maintaining a professional approach to our nearly 1500 customers.

***

One of the main advantages of working with Pro Green Irrigation is our experienced staff, including two full-time installation crews and three professional servicemen. We also have a full office staff, year round employees, and seven fully equipped vehicles. You can trust that Pro Green Irrigation will be around, year in and year out, to service your system and honor our comprehensive 5-Year Warranty *. For all these reasons and many more, Pro Green Irrigation is your lawn sprinkler professional. Pro Green Irrigation is a member of Landscape Ontario and the Canadian Nursery Landscape Association. We continually upgrade our skills with training that keeps us on the cutting edge of irrigation technology. If you would like to see a Pro Green Irrigation system in your area, we'll be happy to give you a list of referrals.

***

*Ask about our 5-year warranty

Geramon Irrigation has been in business over 2 years, in which we are very proud of. One of the reasons for our success is our Service Department, quick, professional, dependable, courteous service is our goal. We have a full time staff of technicians to fill all of your service needs, from the smallest adjustments to the redesign of your system due to landscape or other changes to your property.

We train each technician a minimum of four seasons before they are allowed to service systems on their own. Irrigation is a unique profession, each technician has to know all aspects of the industry, plumbing, electrical, system design, trouble shooting, general building construction, and so much more. To support our technicians in the field we have a full time office staff to answer your questions and schedule your service appointments.

profile:
Northern Lights and Rainmakers Inc. is a family owned and operated landscaping business that has been proudly serving the GTA and surrounding areas for more than 10 years.
***
We specialize in irrigation, lawn care and landscape lighting using the best products available in the industry today including Rain-Bird, Hunter, Toro, Vista, Hadco, etc, thus assuring our customers’ satisfaction for many years to come.
***
We realize that you, our clients, are the lynchpin of our company and that it is your word of mouth recommendations that generate a large percentage of our new business. This is one good reason why we strive daily to renew our reputation for excellent, reliable and honest service and professional workmanship..
But we also take pride in a job well done and get a great deal of satisfaction breathing new life into your gardens and landscapes and seeing them bloom anew after just one or two visits from our work-teams.
name: Northern Rainmakers

profile:
Over the past 26 years and counting, EZ Lawn Sprinklers has seen almost everything there is to see when it comes to installing and maintaining sprinkler systems in Toronto and the GTA. From the initial consultation to the completion of the system installation process, we want you to feel that we delivered what we promised. This is why our staff takes the time to educate you about your new sprinkler system. We will show you how it works, answer any questions, and explain how the reliable timer and rain sensor work and are programmed.

EZ Lawn Sprinklers takes pride in our collaborative approach with our clients. We believe in working together with you to nourish your lawn and plant material while being able to conserve water usage.

Once you learn the ins and outs of the system, your lawn maintenance will seem like it is on autopilot and you will be wondering why you didn’t call us years ago. With our system, your lawn and gardens are always kept healthy without having to spend too much time and effort.

Give us a call or send us an email to discuss how we deliver what we promise.

profile:
We are committed to providing you with a custom designed lawn sprinkler system, tailored to fit the specific needs of your lawn/landscape. Using the highest quality parts for our installations, combined with over 20 years experience. Your water flow will be tested prior to installation to insure proper flow, heads will be laid out according to terrain conditions as well as sun/shade exposure, and your state of the art timer will be set based on the needs of your property. All of this to make sure you are watering the most effectively and as efficiently as possible.
Initial design and  installation of your lawn sprinkler system is crucial to the health and beauty of your property, not to mention cost of operation. Whether you need an irrigation system for your home or business, you can feel confident that your lawn and landscape sprinkler system will be installed and serviced with the best components and backed by a 5 YEAR WARRANTY. Call Five star irrigation system for free estimate.

In addition to lawn sprinkler system, we also provide installations on interlock, flagstone, jewel-stone, concrete, landscaping.
service_area: Gta, Toronto, North York, Scarborough, Etobicoke, Rexdale, Durham Region, Pickering, Ajax, Whitby, Oshawa, Peel Region, Brampton, Mississauga, York Region, Markham, ...
services:
Irrigation Services

Effective sprinkler systems can save time and MONEY while doing something good for the environment. We provide service to residential, commercial and industrial properties of all sizes. From Spring Start-ups to Winter Shut-offs, Five star irrigation system will cater to all you lawn needs.

Spring start-up: 
consists of a full check-up to your sprinkler system. We test your system zone by zone to ensure that your system is fully functioning.

Installation: 
A great benefit to installing a sprinkler system is a healthy lawn, but can also save you a LOT OF MONEY and time. Five star irrigation system will design the perfect system, suitable to your lawn. Our team will evaluate what your property needs, and provide you with an efficient sprinkler system.

Repairs and Maintenance:
We service  all brands of irrigation products, provide maintenance to your system as needed. We also analyze your existing sprinkler systems, and provide any repairs needed. 

Winter Shut-offs: 
Is a process in which we deactivate the electronic controllers and all system valves. We also use air compressor to blow out the water out of the system, preparing your lawn for the winter season.
name: Five Star Irrigation System   No Longer In Business
